channel.title: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?
channel.description: i know the normal SCAR command is Findbitmap(bitmapname,x,y); but i want it look in a certain area of the client for the bitmap, much like the findcolor(x,y,color,xs,xy,xe,ye); command? can anyone help?

item.title: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Sorry if it came out wrong, But that is what I meant,
X & Y are changed in the FindBitmap function to the coordinates it’s found at.

Read full topic
item.source: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?

item.title: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:7, topic:152113”][quote author=script_owned4 link=topic=208066.msg1827974#msg1827974 date=1192671595]

FindBitmap searches the entire Client for a bitmap, And X and Y VARIABLES are changed to the Coordinates the bitmap is found.

FindBitmapIn(bitmap: Integer; var x, y: Integer; x1, y1, x2, y2: Integer): Boolean;

Erm, thats what I pretty much wrote xept I haven’t heard of that function Nashi.

The above still works(the second one).
[/quote]

No, the x, y is the result found.

function FindMyBitmap(bitmap : Integer) : TPoint; var x, y : Integer; begin if FindBitmap(bitmap, x, y) then begin Result.x := x; Result.y := y; end; end;[/quote]
Ahh now I see…

Read full topic
item.source: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?

item.title: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“script_owned4, post:6, topic:152113”][quote author=Nashi link=topic=208066.msg1827257#msg1827257 date=1192621080]
FindBitmap searches the entire Client for a bitmap, And X and Y VARIABLES are changed to the Coordinates the bitmap is found.

FindBitmapIn(bitmap: Integer; var x, y: Integer; x1, y1, x2, y2: Integer): Boolean;
[/quote]
Erm, thats what I pretty much wrote xept I haven’t heard of that function Nashi.

The above still works(the second one).[/quote]

No, the x, y is the result found.

function FindMyBitmap(bitmap : Integer) : TPoint; var x, y : Integer; begin if FindBitmap(bitmap, x, y) then begin Result.x := x; Result.y := y; end; end;

Read full topic

@fook wrote:

it didnt work, i got this error, Line 169: [Error] (168:27): Variable Expected in script C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Owner\My Documents\Scripts\fooktardallin1powerfisher.scar.

item.source: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?

item.title: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

FindBitmap(bitmapname,xaxis(horizontalaxis),yaxis(verticalaxis);

For example:

FindBitmap(fook,102,392);

102 and 392 are the axis points or the coordinates it would look for.

Read full topic
item.source: [question] How do i find a bitmap in a certain area of the client?
